intro: Pseudocadia anomala, commonly known as the slender false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5 to 15 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four petals. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Pseudocadia anomala is native to regions in southern Africa and is adapted to withstand drought and high sunlight exposure.
